revision.comment: /* WW 2 US Army T/Sgt usage */ included timestamp and ID
revision.text: {{WPMILHIST |class=Stub |Aviation-task-force=yes |US-task-force=yes }} =Article Wrong= The article states that the rank of Technical Sergeant was used in the Army and is currently used in the Air Force. The rank was also used in the Marine Corps from 1941 until 1958. Until 1946, it was three chevrons and two horizontal bars. From 1947-1958, it was three chevrons and two curved bars. It has always been equivalent in grade to a Gunnery Sergeant (Grade 2 or E-6, now E-7). http://www.obxmarines.com/documents/rank.html [[User:Kleinhhl|Kleinhhl]] ([[User talk:Kleinhhl|talk]]) 04:16, 7 May 2009 (UTC) =Time In Service Requirements?= I thought the TIS was 5 years for Tech and not 6? 3 for Staff, 5 for Tech 7 for Master. I could be wrong. I will look up and post the answer. =Technical Sergeant Rank in Army= I have a picture of my Grandfather in the Army, and he has a Technical Sergeant symbol like on this article, except it had a "T" in the middle.[[User:TBird100636|TBird100636]] ([[User talk:TBird100636|talk]]) 03:32, 13 December 2009 (UTC) :::Lets see it. --< [[User:FlieGerFaUstMe262|Nicht Nein!]] ([[User talk:FlieGerFaUstMe262|talk]]) 11:18, 7 May 2009 (UTC) ::The T indicates that he was a Technician, not a Technical Sergeant. —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:Xray84|Xray84]] ([[User talk:Xray84|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/Xray84|contribs]]) 00:44, 19 June 2009 (UTC) == WW 2 US Army T/Sgt usage == From 1920 until 1948, the US Army as well as the [[US Army Air Force]] used the rank of T/Sgt with an insignia similar to today's SFC -- three up and two down. See [[United States Army enlisted rank insignia of World War II]]. It would improve the article to include this usage. Unfortunatly, I have no sources except the cited wiki article. --[[User:TGC55|TGC55]] ([[User talk:TGC55|talk]]) 03:01, 29 June 2014 (UTC)
